title: using Windows on different hardware profiles (USB)

forumNotes.author: mr_
forumNotes.content:
Usboot is great to come thought the fiddling of USB booting and starting Windows. I am using my XP on USB on different computers and come along some problems.  

One one computer (notebook) there is an W-LAN chip and you need the driver and software from intel, on another computer has a ATI card the next one Nvidia and so on.  

Most of those drivers are not designed in order to work with different hardware profiles, this means the software will still load even if the device is not attached. The driver software adds autostart entry, registry autostart, drivers and windows services, etc...  

I was trying the internal windows function hardware profiles but this doesn't help much as it don't care about autostart.  

After installing the "wrong" driver software or "to much" there will be serious issues like bluescreen while booting.  

Do you have a suggestion for me how to overcome this? (not the bluescreen, the driver software management on different hardware at all)

Adding to autostart is just one of the things an installer of the driver software would also have done. It's not really working like expected.

forumNotes.author: mr_
forumNotes.content:
Using again this method [http://www.nu2.nu/bootdisk/ntboot/](http://www.nu2.nu/bootdisk/ntboot/ "External link") on my USB-HDD. When I plug in the disk in VMware as physical disk (raw) it will boot ok. On bare metal it's same error message as no boot medium inserted and PLoP will show  
........  
Missing operating system. I was wondering why I can not get my 2.5" USB HDD bootable anymore on USB.   

So I tested the same with a pen drive, same results, bootable on VMware raw but not with VMware/PLoP or bare metal.  

Strange... After using the HP Drive Key I could finally get \*something\* on USB bootable again with VMware/PLoP.  

Can you tell me why it's booting on raw but not when connected by USB? Isn't the MBR/PBR/filesystem the same? What's the difference?  

Also when I use USBoot to copy XP to the single primary/active/nonhidden NTFS partition on USB it will be bootable fine as raw, but not as USB.  

Very strange (it WAS already working in past), can you tell me what to do to ensure to get my USB-HDD bootable for NTFS / NT again?
